ygData.subject: Re: Bards and Everquest books.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail and well met sir, I don t know about completely Everquest-like, but for some great world hopping group oriented fantasy, try David Eddings Belgariad and
ygData.messageBody:
Hail and well met sir,

I don't know about completely Everquest-like, but for some great world
hopping group oriented fantasy, try David Eddings Belgariad and Mallorean
series. Great characters, wonderful story-telling, Everquest-ish
characters. A must read.

Weiland of Freeport
Erollisi Marr


----- Original Message -----
From: GRENON, DANIEL <daniel.grenon@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 1:10 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Bards and Everquest books.


> From: "GRENON, DANIEL" <daniel.grenon@...>
>
> Hi fellow Bards,
>
> I was wondering if any of you got any good suggestions for books
> about Bards that would be Everquest like? And some books about
> Everquest in general too would be fun to read. I never read a Fantasy
> book or played a fantasy game (but tons of sci-fi), so I'm new with this
>
> genre I would like to start with light stuff not too complicated.
>
>
> Thank you,
> The invisible Bard of the E'ci dimension.
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> What do lizards and rock music have in common?
> http://www.onelist.com
> They both have communities at ONElist. Find yours today!
>
